properties.areaDesc: Ozark, MO; Howell, MO; Douglas, MO; Wright, MO; Oregon, MO; Texas, MO
properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 12 at 2:33PM CST until February 12 at 8:30PM CST by NWS Springfield MO
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a

* Flood Advisory for...
Ozark County in southwestern Missouri...
Douglas County in southwestern Missouri...
Southeastern Wright County in southwestern Missouri...
Howell County in south central Missouri...
Southern Texas County in south central Missouri...
Oregon County in south central Missouri...

* Until 830 PM CST.

* At 230 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain that will cause
minor flooding in the advisory area. Radar estimates 1.00 to 1.25
inches of rain have fallen in this area since early Wednesday
morning. There have been reports of a few low water crossings
impassable due to high water.

* Creeks, streams, and low water crossings will be especially
susceptible to the dangers of flooding.
Locations in the advisory include...
West Plains...                    Grand Gulf State Park...
Mountain Grove...                 Mountain View...
Thayer...                         Willow Springs...
Cabool...                         Houston...
Alton...                          Gainesville...
Dawson...                         Norwood...
Pomona...                         Bakersfield...
Theodosia...                      South Fork...
Koshkonong...                     Pontiac...
Brandsville...                    Wasola...

This advisory includes but is not limited to the following low water
crossings...
Route FF at Hunter Creek east of Ava...
Route FF at Turkey Creek east of Ava...
Highway 142 at The Spring River west of Lanton...
Highway 142 at The Bennetts River west of Moody...
and Route K, 3 miles southwest of Pottersville.
properties.instruction:
Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of small
creeks and streams, country roads, farmland, and other low lying
spots.

In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are
potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded
roads. Find an alternate route.
